p:
The changes in bonding between SCU and SCU@CD-MOF were carried out by SR-FTIR ( Fig. 3D). The characteristic peaks of SCU were –OH groups at 3000‒3600 cm −1, C–H stretching vibration at 2920 cm −1, C
000000000000 000000000000 000000000000 111111111111 000000000000 111111111111 000000000000 000000000000 000000000000 O stretching vibration at 1725 cm −1, benzene skeleton vibration at 1664, 1610 and 1577 cm −1, and C–H out-of-plane bending vibration at 844 and 835 cm −1. The spectrum of the physical mixture was the superposition of SCU and CD-MOF with obvious characteristic absorption peaks. Moreover, the C
O stretching vibration peak at 1725 cm −1 of SCU disappeared in SCU@CD-MOF, indicating that strong host–guest interaction between SCU and CD-MOF.
